sentences.sentence: He looked through the window, and saw the bright yellow moon hanging in the night sky.
Then he fell asleep again, and dreamed, and this was his dream.
He dreamed that he was on a huge ship that was being rowed by a hundred slaves( 奴隶 ).
By the young King’s side the master( 主人 ) of the ship was seated.
His skin was black, and his clothes were made of red silk.
The slaves( 奴隶 ) had no clothes except for a thin piece of cloth( 布 ) around their waist( 腰部 ), and each slave( 奴隶 ) was chained( 用锁链拴住 ) to the man next to him.
They pulled the heavy oars( 船桨 ) through the water, while the master( 主人 ) and his men hit them with whips( 鞭子 ).
Over their heads, the hot sun shone brightly down upon them.
At last the master( 主人 ) called for them to stop rowing, when the ship had reached a little bay( 海湾 ).
As soon as the men had dropped the anchor( 船锚 ) and taken down the sail( 船帆 ), the master( 主人 ) ordered his men to bring a ladder( 梯子 ) out from inside the ship.
The bottom of the ladder( 梯子 ) was heavily weighted with metal( 金属 ), and the master( 主人 ) of the ship threw it over the side and tied the top of it to the ship.
Then the master( 主人 ) ordered his men to grab( 抓来 ) one of the younger slaves( 奴隶 ), and they filled his ears and nose with wax( 蜡 ), and tied a heavy stone around his waist( 腰部 ).
The young slave( 奴隶 ) then climbed down the ladder( 梯子 ) with a tired look, and disappeared into the sea.
After some time, the young slave( 奴隶 ) came out of the water, and held onto the ladder( 梯子 ) while breathing( 喘息 ) heavily.
He held a pearl( 珍珠 ) in his right hand, and the master( 主人 ) grabbed( 夺走 ) it from his hand.
Then he pushed him back into the water, to dive( 潜水 ) down again.
Again and again the young slave( 奴隶 ) came up, and each time that he did so he brought with him a beautiful pearl( 珍珠 ).
The master( 主人 ) of the ship weighed them, and put them into a little bag.
The young King tried to speak, but his tongue( 舌头 ) did not seem to work, and his lips( 嘴唇 ) refused to move.
Then the young slave( 奴隶 ) came up for the last time, and the pearl( 珍珠 ) that he brought with him was the most beautiful pearl( 珍珠 ) that the young King had ever seen.
It was shaped like the full moon, and whiter than the morning star.
But the young slave( 奴隶 )’s face was strangely pale, and as he climbed into the ship he fell down, and blood poured( 喷涌而出 ) from his ears and nose.
He shook for a little while, and then he was still( 静止不动的 ).
The master( 主人 ) did not seem concerned at all, and he ordered his men to throw the body into the sea.
The master( 主人 ) of the ship laughed, and reached out and took the pearl( 珍珠 ).
And then he pressed it against his head and bowed( 点头 ).
“It will be,” he said, “for the scepter( 权杖 ) of the young King.”
When the young King heard this, he gave a loud cry and then woke up( 醒来 ).
He looked through the window, and saw the long grey fingers of morning light reaching across the sky.
And then he fell asleep again, and dreamed, and this was his dream.
He dreamed that he was walking through a dark forest, where the trees grew strange fruits and beautiful flowers.
From branch( 树枝 ) to branch( 树枝 ) flew brightly colored parrots( 鹦鹉 ), and in the trees were large snakes and wild monkeys.
On and on he went, until he reached the edge of the forest, and there he saw a huge crowd( 人群 ) of men working at the bottom of a dried-up river.
They dug deep holes in the ground and went down into them.
They rushed around( 奔忙 ), calling to each other, and every man was busy.
From the darkness of a cave( 洞 ), Death and Greed( 贪婪 ) watched them,
and Death said, “I am tired of this place. Give me a third of the men and let me go.”
But Greed( 贪婪 ) shook her head. “They are my servants,” she answered.
And then Death said to her, “What is that in your hand?”
“I have three grains( 粒 ) of corn,” she answered. “What is that to you?”
“Give me one of them,” cried Death, “to plant in my garden.
I only want one of them, and then I will go away.”
“I will not give you anything,” said Greed( 贪婪 ), and she hid her hand in her clothes.

article_info.previous: 少年国王梦到自己到了一间幽暗的屋子，看到一群人正在辛苦地工作，甚至还有一些小孩子。言谈中，国王了解到，这些人正在赶制自己加冕礼的礼袍......
article_info.share_words: After some time, the young slave came out of the water, and held onto the ladder while breathing heavily. He held a pearl in his right hand, and the master grabbed it from his hand. Then he pushed him back into the water, to dive down again.

question.cn: 为什么主人要让奴隶潜进水里？
question.en: Why did the master send the slave to dive into the water?

options.cn: 因为他想要奴隶找到美丽的珍珠。
options.en: Because he wanted the slave to find beautiful pearls.

options.cn: 因为他想要奴隶去抓鱼。
options.en: Because he wanted the slave to catch fish.

analysis: 文中提到：“After some time, the young slave came out of the water, and held onto the ladder while breathing heavily. He held a pearl in his right hand, and the master grabbed it from his hand. ”因此本题选B。

question.en: What happened to the young slave at last?

options.en: He fell asleep on the boat.
He was beaten by the master.

analysis: 文中提到“But the young slave’s face was strangely pale, and as he climbed into the ship he fell down, and blood poured from his ears and nose. He shook for a little while, and then he was still. The master did not seem concerned at all, and he ordered his men to throw the body into the sea.”可知年轻奴隶是去世了，因此本题选C。

options.en: The pearl was for an exhibition
The pearl was for the King's scepter.

analysis: 文中提到“The master of the ship laughed, and reached out and took the pearl. And then he pressed it against his head and bowed. ‘It will be,’ he said, ‘for the scepter of the young King.’”因此本题选C。

question.cn: “死亡”和“贪欲”之间的对话发生在哪里？
question.en: Where did the conversation between “Death” and “Greed” take place?

options.en: In a cave at the edge of the forest.

analysis: 文中提到：On and on he went, until he reached the edge of the forest. . . From the darkness of a cave, Death and Greed watched them, and Death said, “I am tired of this place. Give me a third of the men and let me go.” But Greed shook her head. “They are my servants,” she answered. 因此本题选B。
